scenario_I_(0).prompt:
<input>
        # file: JSON Entities file
            description:
                This JSON data is a response of a GET request to the API of an IoT platform, 
                which contains all the literal entities of a building and its systematic components, available sensors and actuators. 
            content:
                <data>[
  {
    "id": "Hotel:hotel:aachen:001",
    "type": "Hotel",
    "address": {
      "type": "None",
      "value": null,

      "metadata": {}
    }
  },

    },

      "metadata": {}
    }
  },
  {

        </input>
        <context>
        # Results of Preprocessing of the JSON file: 
{'api_endpoint': 'https://fiware.eonerc.rwth-aachen.de/v2/entities/{entityId}/attrs/{attrName}/value', 'numerical_properties': ['temperatureAmb', 'temperature', 'co2', 'pir', 'airFlowSetpoint', 'temperatureSetpoint', 'fanSpeed'], 'relational_properties': ['hasLocation', 'name'], 'entity_mappings': {'Hotel': 'rec:Building', 'AmbientTemperatureSensor': 'brick:Air_Temperature_Sensor', 'HotelRoom': 'rec:Bedroom', 'TemperatureSensor': 'brick:Temperature_Sensor', 'CO2Sensor': 'brick:CO2_Sensor', 'PresenceSensor': 'brick:Occupancy_Sensor', 'FreshAirVentilation': 'brick:Ventilation_Air_System', 'RadiatorThermostat': 'brick:HVAC_Equipment', 'CoolingCoil': 'brick:Cooling_Coil'}, 'relational_property_mappings': {'hasLocation': 'brick:hasLocation', 'name': 'bacnet:object-name'}, 'extra_nodes': {'properties_requiring_extra_nodes': ['airFlowSetpoint', 'temperatureSetpoint', 'fanSpeed'], 'extra_node_names': ['AirFlowSetpoint', 'TemperatureSetpoint', 'FanSpeedSetpoint'], 'extra_node_mappings': {'AirFlowSetpoint': 'brick:Air_Flow_Setpoint', 'TemperatureSetpoint': 'brick:Temperature_Setpoint', 'FanSpeedSetpoint': 'brick:Speed_Setpoint'}}}
        
        # Knowledge Graph 
        The knowledge graph is a structured representation of the building's systematic components, including rooms, ventilation devices, sensors, and their relationships. 
        It is built from the provided JSON entities file of a GET request to a specific IoT platform.

        <constraints>MOST IMPORTANT: RDF should follow a valid turtle syntax!</constraints>

        <template>
{ONTOLOGY_PREFIXES}
@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .

# This template defines reusable pattens for a knowledge graph of IoT entities
# Terms in curly braces {} are placeholders to be replaced with terms

# BUILDING BLOCK: Numerical Relationships of Entities
<http://example.com/{ENTITY_TYPE}/{ID}> a {ONTOLOGY_CLASS} ;
    rdf:value <{API_ENDPOINT_URL}> ;

# BUILDING BLOCK: Numerical Relationships of Entities & Non-numerical Relationships between Entities
<http://example.com/{ENTITY_TYPE}/{ID}> a {ONTOLOGY_CLASS} ;
    rdf:value <{API_ENDPOINT_URL}> ;
    {ONTOLOGY_ROPERTY} <http://example.com/{ENTITY_TYPE}/{ID}> .

# BUILDING BLOCK: Non-numerical Relationships between Entities
<http://example.com/{ENTITY_TYPE}/{ID}> a {ONTOLOGY_CLASS} ;
    {ONTOLOGY_ROPERTY} <http://example.com/{ENTITY_TYPE}/{ID}> .

# BUILDING BLOCK: Top-Level Spatial Entities
<http://example.com/{ENTITY_TYPE}/{ID}> a {ONTOLOGY_CLASS} .

</template>
        <data>
Ontology prefixes:
@prefix bacnet: <http://data.ashrae.org/bacnet/2020#> .
@prefix brick: <https://brickschema.org/schema/Brick#> .
@prefix bsh: <https://brickschema.org/schema/BrickShape#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .
@prefix qudt: <http://qudt.org/schema/qudt/> .
@prefix qudtqk: <http://qudt.org/vocab/quantitykind/> .
@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix rec: <https://w3id.org/rec#> .
@prefix ref: <https://brickschema.org/schema/Brick/ref#> .
@prefix s223: <http://data.ashrae.org/standard223#> .
@prefix sdo: <http://schema.org/> .
@prefix sh: <http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix sosa: <http://www.w3.org/ns/sosa/> .
@prefix tag: <https://brickschema.org/schema/BrickTag#> .
@prefix unit: <http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/> .
@prefix vcard: <http://www.w3.org/2006/vcard/ns#> .
@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .
</data>
        
        </context>

        <instructions>
        Generate the RDF knowledge graph from the provided JSON Entities data of a GET request to the IoT platform based on the template.
        For every entity in the JSON Entities file and for every Extra Node, create a corresponding entity in the RDF graph.
        For each RDF entity, choose a suitable block from the template and fill out the placeholders with the results of Preprocessing of the JSON file.
        For connecting extra nodes to the parent entities, choose a previously mapped ontology property for relations.
        Use the given prefixes.
        For the 'http://example.com/' URI, do not use a prefix, but use the full URI in angle brackets.

        Do not use any other information to fill out the RDF graph.
        If you have any doubts, fill in a marker at the point and add a comment with your question.
        </instructions>

        <output> Return the knowledge graph in Turtle format. </output>
scenario_I_(0).response:
<output>
```turtle
@prefix bacnet: <http://data.ashrae.org/bacnet/2020#> .
@prefix brick: <https://brickschema.org/schema/Brick#> .
@prefix bsh: <https://brickschema.org/schema/BrickShape#> .
@prefix dcterms: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/> .
@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .
@prefix qudt: <http://qudt.org/schema/qudt/> .
@prefix qudtqk: <http://qudt.org/vocab/quantitykind/> .
@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .
@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .
@prefix rec: <https://w3id.org/rec#> .
@prefix ref: <https://brickschema.org/schema/Brick/ref#> .
@prefix s223: <http://data.ashrae.org/standard223#> .
@prefix sdo: <http://schema.org/> .
@prefix sh: <http://www.w3.org/ns/shacl#> .
@prefix skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#> .
@prefix sosa: <http://www.w3.org/ns/sosa/> .
@prefix tag: <https://brickschema.org/schema/BrickTag#> .
@prefix unit: <http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/> .
@prefix vcard: <http://www.w3.org/2006/vcard/ns#> .
@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .

# Hotel Building
<http://example.com/Hotel/hotel:aachen:001> a rec:Building ;
    bacnet:object-name "hotel:aachen:001" .

# Ambient Temperature Sensor
<http://example.com/AmbientTemperatureSensor/AmbientTemperatureSensor> a brick:Air_Temperature_Sensor ;
    rdf:value <https://fiware.eonerc.rwth-aachen.de/v2/entities/AmbientTemperatureSensor/attrs/temperatureAmb/value> ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/Hotel/hotel:aachen:001> .

# Hotel Room 1
<http://example.com/HotelRoom/room_base_1> a rec:Bedroom ;
    bacnet:object-name "room_base_1" ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/Hotel/hotel:aachen:001> .

# Temperature Sensor - Room 1
<http://example.com/TemperatureSensor/room_base_1> a brick:Temperature_Sensor ;
    rdf:value <https://fiware.eonerc.rwth-aachen.de/v2/entities/TemperatureSensor:room_base_1/attrs/temperature/value> ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/HotelRoom/room_base_1> .

# CO2 Sensor - Room 1
<http://example.com/CO2Sensor/room_base_1> a brick:CO2_Sensor ;
    rdf:value <https://fiware.eonerc.rwth-aachen.de/v2/entities/CO2Sensor:room_base_1/attrs/co2/value> ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/HotelRoom/room_base_1> .

# Presence Sensor - Room 1
<http://example.com/PresenceSensor/room_base_1> a brick:Occupancy_Sensor ;
    rdf:value <https://fiware.eonerc.rwth-aachen.de/v2/entities/PresenceSensor:room_base_1/attrs/pir/value> ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/HotelRoom/room_base_1> .

# Fresh Air Ventilation - Room 1
<http://example.com/FreshAirVentilation/room_base_1> a brick:Ventilation_Air_System ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/HotelRoom/room_base_1> .

# Air Flow Setpoint for Fresh Air Ventilation - Room 1
<http://example.com/AirFlowSetpoint/room_base_1> a brick:Air_Flow_Setpoint ;
    rdf:value <https://fiware.eonerc.rwth-aachen.de/v2/entities/FreshAirVentilation:room_base_1/attrs/airFlowSetpoint/value> ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/FreshAirVentilation/room_base_1> .

# Radiator Thermostat - Room 1
<http://example.com/RadiatorThermostat/room_base_1> a brick:HVAC_Equipment ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/HotelRoom/room_base_1> .

# Temperature Setpoint for Radiator Thermostat - Room 1
<http://example.com/TemperatureSetpoint/room_base_1> a brick:Temperature_Setpoint ;
    rdf:value <https://fiware.eonerc.rwth-aachen.de/v2/entities/RadiatorThermostat:room_base_1/attrs/temperatureSetpoint/value> ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/RadiatorThermostat/room_base_1> .

# Cooling Coil - Room 1
<http://example.com/CoolingCoil/room_base_1> a brick:Cooling_Coil ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/HotelRoom/room_base_1> .

# Fan Speed Setpoint for Cooling Coil - Room 1
<http://example.com/FanSpeedSetpoint/room_base_1> a brick:Speed_Setpoint ;
    rdf:value <https://fiware.eonerc.rwth-aachen.de/v2/entities/CoolingCoil:room_base_1/attrs/fanSpeed/value> ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/CoolingCoil/room_base_1> .

# Hotel Room 2
<http://example.com/HotelRoom/room_base_2> a rec:Bedroom ;
    bacnet:object-name "room_base_2" ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/Hotel/hotel:aachen:001> .

# Temperature Sensor - Room 2
<http://example.com/TemperatureSensor/room_base_2> a brick:Temperature_Sensor ;
    rdf:value <https://fiware.eonerc.rwth-aachen.de/v2/entities/TemperatureSensor:room_base_2/attrs/temperature/value> ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/HotelRoom/room_base_2> .

# CO2 Sensor - Room 2
<http://example.com/CO2Sensor/room_base_2> a brick:CO2_Sensor ;
    rdf:value <https://fiware.eonerc.rwth-aachen.de/v2/entities/CO2Sensor:room_base_2/attrs/co2/value> ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/HotelRoom/room_base_2> .

# Presence Sensor - Room 2
<http://example.com/PresenceSensor/room_base_2> a brick:Occupancy_Sensor ;
    rdf:value <https://fiware.eonerc.rwth-aachen.de/v2/entities/PresenceSensor:room_base_2/attrs/pir/value> ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/HotelRoom/room_base_2> .

# Fresh Air Ventilation - Room 2
<http://example.com/FreshAirVentilation/room_base_2> a brick:Ventilation_Air_System ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/HotelRoom/room_base_2> .

# Air Flow Setpoint for Fresh Air Ventilation - Room 2
<http://example.com/AirFlowSetpoint/room_base_2> a brick:Air_Flow_Setpoint ;
    rdf:value <https://fiware.eonerc.rwth-aachen.de/v2/entities/FreshAirVentilation:room_base_2/attrs/airFlowSetpoint/value> ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/FreshAirVentilation/room_base_2> .

# Radiator Thermostat - Room 2
<http://example.com/RadiatorThermostat/room_base_2> a brick:HVAC_Equipment ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/HotelRoom/room_base_2> .

# Temperature Setpoint for Radiator Thermostat - Room 2
<http://example.com/TemperatureSetpoint/room_base_2> a brick:Temperature_Setpoint ;
    rdf:value <https://fiware.eonerc.rwth-aachen.de/v2/entities/RadiatorThermostat:room_base_2/attrs/temperatureSetpoint/value> ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/RadiatorThermostat/room_base_2> .

# Cooling Coil - Room 2
<http://example.com/CoolingCoil/room_base_2> a brick:Cooling_Coil ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/HotelRoom/room_base_2> .

# Fan Speed Setpoint for Cooling Coil - Room 2
<http://example.com/FanSpeedSetpoint/room_base_2> a brick:Speed_Setpoint ;
    rdf:value <https://fiware.eonerc.rwth-aachen.de/v2/entities/CoolingCoil:room_base_2/attrs/fanSpeed/value> ;
    brick:hasLocation <http://example.com/CoolingCoil/room_base_2> .
```
</output>
